text: having one today I'm making one hair or
pan-fried child dumplings these were
brought to Vietnam by the Chinese and
it's very popularly sold in Chinatown in
Ho Chi Minh City
they are steamed until the wrapper turns
quite translucent and then quickly pan
fry to make the top and bottom quite
crispy if you love chives and dumplings
at Masha I do I'm sure you're going to
go to the kitchen right after watching
this clip let's begin recipe to make
four dumplings you're gonna need 100
gram of tapioca starch and 100 gram of
rice flour the tapioca starch is what
made it translucent and chewy the rice
flour is what make it soft and quite
crispy when we pan fry in a large mixing
bowl mix together the tapioca starch and
the rice flour together with half a
teaspoon of salt mix really well and
then make a well in the center measure
175 ml of boiling hot water and pour
into the well as the water is really hot
you want to stir up with a spatula first
so the flour can absorb all the liquid
and let it cool down a little bit then
use your hands you need into a dough
it's going to take about five to ten
minutes and the dough is formed it's
very soft and smooth then cover with
plastic wrap and let the dough rest for
about 30 minutes
next we'll prepare the fillings you will
need about 80 gram of garlic chives if
you don't have or don't like chives you
can use spring onion links tact
remove the bad parts and rinse well and
then chop them up mix the college chives
with about 100 gram of mince meat you
can also use minced rims means mushrooms
or to simply quickly stir-fry the choice
to make a vegetarian version season with
some wings garlic salt and pepper to
taste
TSP or chicken stock can have a TSP of
sugar mix well and set aside for about
15 minutes now take out the dough and
roll it into a long stick divided into
four equal portions flour the working
surface and roll out each piece into the
thickness of about 2 millimeters also
divide the fillings into four equal
portions and place one portion into the
center folding the size and pinch the
ecchi together to seal and shape the
dumplings into a flat and round shape
repeat with the rest of the dough
then place them into a steamer basket
light with a piece of banana leaf or
parchment paper leaving some space in
between the dumplings so they won't
stick to each other steam for about 20
minutes or until you can see through the
green color of the chives take them out
and leave for about 15 to 30 minutes so
they cool down and also The Wrap will
have time to get a little bit drier now
in a non-stick pan add just a little bit
of vegetable oil about a teaspoon and a
few drops of sesame oil to make it more
fragrant heat it up and pan fry until
the dumplings turn golden brown on both
sides you can also skip the pan frying
and set the dumplings freshly out of the
steamer you can serve this with a
Chinese start dipping sauce which is a
mix of thick soy sauce and some black
vinegar or our Vietnamese start dipping
sauce which composes off one part sugar
one part fish sauce three parts water
and some garlic and chilies mmm let me
give it a try the outer wrapper is
crusty and chewy the garlic chives and
mint meat inside is very well seasoned
and fragrant it's a really great
dumplings I hope you like it too
and if you give it a try please share
photo on instagram with hashtag and
recipes also don't forget to click
thumbs up and subscribe to my channel
for more delicious Vietnamese food thank
you for watching bye bye
